I.i.1.A.4.d
.
Definition:  Competent Medical Evidence
Competent medical evidence
means evidence provided by a person who is qualified through education, training, or experience to offer medical diagnoses, statements, or opinions.  Competent medical evidence may also mean statements conveying sound medical principles found in medical treatises. It would also include statements contained in authoritative writings such as medical and scientific articles and research reports or analyses.
Reference
:  The definition of competent medical evidence for the purpose of this chapter is set forth in
38 CFR 3.159(a)(1)
.
title: M21-1, Part I, Subpart i, Chapter 1, Section A - Description and General Information on Duty to Notify and Duty to Assist
citation: Part I, Subpart i, Chapter 1, Section A
